senses.sense_definition: The philosophical system based on the teachings of <w>Epicurus</w>, holding that the highest good is pleasure achieved through virtue and the avoidance of pain.

examples.text: She studied <w>epicureanism</w> to understand how ancient thinkers approached the concept of happiness.
The professor explained that true <w>epicureanism</w> values mental peace over physical indulgence.

senses.sense_definition: A lifestyle devoted to the refined enjoyment of food, drink, and comfort.

examples.text: His <w>epicureanism</w> led him to travel the world in search of the finest cuisines and wines.
The banquet was a celebration of pure <w>epicureanism</w>, featuring dishes from renowned chefs.

senses.sense_definition: Disbelief in the existence of God or divine providence.

examples.text: In the seventeenth century, charges of <w>epicureanism</w> were often leveled against those who questioned religious dogma.
The theologian wrote a treatise condemning <w>epicureanism</w> as a danger to the soul.
